alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Kaibab Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued June 12 at 1:59PM MST until June 13 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MST (12 PM TO 9 PM MDT) MONDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Flagstaff to Williams, the Kaibab Plateau, and much of northeast Arizona. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 8 PM MST (12 PM to 9 PM MDT) Monday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. In addition, winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing dust are likely during this time, especially in northeast Arizona. This includes portions of I-40 just east of Flagstaff to the New Mexico border as well as Highway 89 from Flagstaff to Page.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
